attributes.action: Improve CAMHS services in Cumbria, especially surrounding eating disorders.
attributes.background: There is a huge lack of resources and staff within Cumbria CAMHS, having just one dietitician in the entire county. The team regularly allows patients suffering from eating disorders to get so severe they require inpatient treatment hundreds of miles away.There are no specialists and a lack of care.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS stands for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services, and this is where children and teenagers up to the age of 18 get support and therapy for their mental illnesses. 
There are NO specialist eating disorder services within the whole county; the closest being Middlesborough, which I am currently staying as an inpatient with severe Anorexia Nervosa for the second time due to the immense lack of support and understanding in Cumbria. This is a 2 and a half hour journey. 
This is not fair.

attributes.action: I want the mandatory tv licence in September to be abolished.
attributes.background: Come September 1 2016 you will be required by law to purchase a television licence, regardless of how you watch - this includes YouTube and BBC iPlayer etc.
attributes.additional_details:
From the TV licence website - 

No matter what device you use, you must be covered by a TV Licence if you watch or record live TV. This includes:
TV sets
Laptops and desktop computers
Tablets, mobile phones, satnavs and other portable devices
Digital boxes (PVRs), satellite and cable, e.g. Freeview, Freesat, Sky, Virgin Media, BT Vision, YouView, Apple TV, Chromecast, Roku and Amazon Fire TV
Games consoles
DVD, Blu-ray and VHS recorders

http://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/check-if-you-need-one

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wages for 17-20 year olds.
attributes.background: National minimum wage for 17-20 year old's should be increased, wages they receive are not just. Being a 20 year old earning £5.50 p/h is inadequate, knowing how much effort and sacrifice you put into working alongside studying. Yet we are liable for paying adult fares on public transport.

attributes.action: Shouting Racist when it is not to be charged for ''Incitement to racial hatred"
attributes.background: People who shout RACIST and point the finger when it is not are causing major hate and divisions in the UK and should be imprisoned for ''Incitement to racial hatred"
attributes.additional_details:
Everyday online and in the media we hear of RACISM when it is not. We see Labour Councillors and MPs crying Racist when people are just trying to express how they feel.

This shouting of Racism takes the light off real Racist and Racism and the people of the UK are now starting to forget real racist attacks as they are ''FED UP'' with being branded a racist when they are not.

attributes.action: Ensure UK-EU Brexit deal retains our "passporting" rights in financial services
attributes.background: If we lose passporting rights in financial services due to Brexit it could be very damaging for the UK economy as firms re-locate activities to financial centres in the EU; this key issue has been largely ignored by politicians and this petition gives citizens a voice to help protect our economy

attributes.action: Government to condemn the USA police forces for killing innocent Black citizens
attributes.background: Statistics show that on average around 30 African American citizens in America are killed by law enforcement officers each month.  This is unacceptable in a civilized society.  The UK is America's closest alley and so should be able to speak up and ask that America takes measures to stop this issue.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_killings_by_law_enforcement_officers_in_the_United_States

attributes.action: Remove all subsidies for fossil fuels, use them to subsidise renewable energy.
attributes.background: It's impossible for the government to simultaneously state their commitment to combating climate change and subsidise fossil fuels to the extent that they do. The amount of money spent on renewable energy is meanwhile decreasing. Spending more on renewable's is the only way to show real commitment.
attributes.additional_details: Subsidies for fossil fuels which approach £6 billion a year are being given to companies which generate profits in the hundreds of millions. That money is far better used to subsidies to production and implementation of renewable energies or to subsidies the household energy bills. There is an estimated 26.7 million households in the UK, the money could be used to decrease the annual energy bill by £224. Stop giving to the rich, start giving to the people.

attributes.action: Reform the law on the defence of Insanity to benefit the mentally ill
attributes.background:
The Law Commission Report in 2013 recommended a new defence with a special verdict of "not criminally responsible by reason of a recognised medical condition".
Unfortunately this slipped through government policy making and has been ignored since.
attributes.additional_details:
The current law on insanity was made in 1848 when psychaitric illness was hardly understood. 
Despite huge developments in understanding, diagnosis  and treating mental illness, the M'Naughten Rules on insanity have remained unchanged. 
Reintroducing the proposed reform by the Law Commission would mean that people with actual medical conditions won't be excluded by the law and will stop the mentally/physically ill from pleading guilty to avoid the stigma of being classed as insane.

attributes.action: All HGVs and PCVs on british roads to have driver monitoring technology
attributes.background: Distraction such as mobile phone usage or 'micro sleeping' are major contributing factors to many deaths on British roads. Result can be much worse when in control of a HGV or PCV. Legislation to ensure that these class' of vehicle are fitted with the driver monitoring technology will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-10-31/lorry-driver-who-killed-mother-and-three-children-while-on-mobile-phone-sentenced-for-10-years/

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/aug/04/lorry-driver-danny-warby-found-guilty-crash-death-sharon-garrett-cambridgeshire

http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/drivers/fatigue/road-accidents/

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/tiredness-can-kill-advice-for-drivers


http://www.brake.org.uk/wake-up/15-facts-a-resources/facts/485-driver-tiredness

attributes.action: Ban FRACKING in the UK!!
attributes.background:
Fracking leads to devastating consequences for the environment. 
It contaminates groundwater with the use of toxic chemicals, contaminates the land, can cause earthquakes!
attributes.additional_details: Science!!!

attributes.action: Make statutory holiday entitlement 26 days plus bank holidays
attributes.background: Currently school holidays excluding bank holiday days equate to 52 days off per year, those who work struggle to cover these dates using their holiday entitlement from work.
attributes.additional_details:
We are asking that the government raise statutory holiday entitlement to 26 days per year plus bank holidays (34 total) to enable working parents to cover childcare during school holidays. The legal entitlement at present is 28 days and employers can choose to have 8 of those as bank holidays.
Currently school holidays excluding bank holiday days equate to 52 days off per year, those who work struggle to cover these dates using their holiday entitlement from work.

attributes.action: Require all local councils in England to use LED bulbs in street lights.
attributes.background: Sodium lighting is commonplace in British towns and cities. These orange lights cause a large amount of light pollution and make it difficult for most of us to see a full starry sky [1]. A switch to Amber LED lighting would improve these conditions greatly and would also be more energy efficient [2]
attributes.additional_details:
1. http://nightblight.cpre.org.uk/maps/ - The light pollution map for the UK 
2. http://www1.eere.energy.gov/buildings/publications/pdfs/alliances/outdoor_area_lighting.pdf - The American "Office of Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy'"s report on new LED installation. 
- On the topic of Amber LED: In this case amber is the suggested colour as dimming the LEDs is the key in reducing light pollution emmisions, it also reduces blue-light exposure. http://darksky.org/lighting/led-practical-guide/

attributes.action: Any future referendum vote on Scottish Independence must be given to all the UK.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom is exactly that..United.  As part of a legal union Scotland should NOT be able to decide alone on independence as the consequences will affect ALL of the UK economically and politically.

attributes.action: Build new runways at Heathrow and Gatwick to future proof UK airport capacity
attributes.background: Heathrow often runs at 98% capcity, and is the busiest two runway airport in the world.  Likewise Gatwick is the busiest single runway airport in the world.  The capacity is long overdue, and planes are circling both hubs emitting more CO2 than necessary. Build both runways as soon as possible.
attributes.additional_details:
Gatwick has the world's busiest single-use runway. It does have two runways on site but the close proximity of the two and the length and lack of guidance for the second means that only one is used. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World%27s_busiest_airport#Busiest_airports
The plan to expand Heathrow was supported by businesses, the aviation industry, the British Chambers of Commerce, the Confederation of British Industry, the Trades Union Congress and the then Labour government. 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heathrow_Airport
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-37566361

attributes.action: Gain funding, raise awareness&reintroduce oral health education back into the UK
attributes.background: I have created this petition to gain support in introducing Oral Health Education back into the UK. As a dental nurse working in the UK I witness the daily effects&trauma that tooth decay in children under the age of 18 causes. I would like to reintroduce OHE into: nurseries,schools&the community.
attributes.additional_details:
Facts and figures:
+ More than 128,000 children under 10 had at least 1 tooth removed since 2011-2016

+ Hospitals are at 'crisis point' for children needing teeth extracted under general anaesthetic

+ £30 million spent on hospital based extractions between 2012-2013 on those aged 18 and under

+ 90% of tooth decay was preventable

+ Dental treatment is FREE for those aged under 18

attributes.action: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens.
attributes.background: Make University fee's cheaper for over seas students and free for UK citizens. This will allow more students to have the opportunity to get a degree and be able to apply for the best jobs.

attributes.action: Strengthen Laws against Negligent Private Surgeons & Healthcare Providers
attributes.background:
Private healthcare patients are commonly led to believe that the care they are paying for will meet the highest standards. 
In cases where patients receive wrongful or negligent treatment  private healthcare patients have less access to adequate redress and compensation than NHS patients.
attributes.additional_details:
At present legislation is so insufficient that one private healthcare company actually stated in a legal defence document that they were ‘under no obligation to provide competent surgeons to perform surgery at the hospital’ and had ‘no duty to protect patients from harm, and risk of injury’.

We ask Secretary of State for Health, Jeremy Hunt  to close the legal loophole which allows for private healthcare patients to be left without protection or redress when things go wrong.

attributes.action: Make UK pet stores ban all pet products made in China
attributes.background: There are cases every single day of dogs and cats dying horrific deaths due to the chemicals and processes used to produce pet products in China. Their relentless disregard for pet health makes them unfit to produce these products and it's time the UK pet stores ban all China-made products.

attributes.action: Please start funding pet cemeteries like other country's.
attributes.background: I think we can all agree that our pets are more than just pets, they become best friends and family members. it is only because of my dog that I can leave my house due to my mental health. He is my bet friend and I think others will agree we need a place to rest them just like we do with people.
attributes.additional_details: As a lot of us see them as more than pets, we should have places where we can bury them and let them rest in piece. They are loved ones and should be treated as such. They don't ask for a lot in life, all they ask for is love and care and don't we all just want love? If you look after your animal, they will look after you. Please consider this as I can assure you, many, many people will really appreciate being able to use these places. Thank you.

attributes.action: Repeal tail docking ban for KC working breeds at the very least The Dobermann
attributes.background: In 2007 the government banned the docking of tails, but allowed some working breeds to continue to be docked, 9yrs down the line and the amount of damaged tails is causing immeasurable suffering Please think carefully and help to end the suffering of these dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence will be updated daily here from July 26th 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/1753160231634236/
Repeal the ban or at the very least allow all breeds classified as Working Group dogs have their tails docked by a vet. Older dogs having tails amputated is not acceptable.The Doberman has been 
traditionally docked from its creation, now with tails we have 
varying degrees of length carriage and thickness this is causing unnecessary suffering. Allow docking by a vet within 3 days of birth.

attributes.action: The government is to declassify all plans on TTIP & make plans available online
attributes.background: Such a large trade deal should be available for all the public to read and scrutinise, why is it that we are having to request this information into the public eye. We want this information to be accessible to all people, as we all know the consequences of deals made outside the democratic arena.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transatlantic_Trade_and_Investment_Partnership

attributes.action: Save Dunelm House (Durham Uni student union), by giving it Grade II listing.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State has refused an application from Historic England for Grade II listing. The granting of a Certificate of Immunity is now being considered with the intention that the building be demolished. We would like the Secretary to reconsider Grade II listing status.
attributes.additional_details:
It won both a Civic Trust award and the RIBA Bronze Medal 1966. The building has subsequently been praised many times. It needs to be saved as a key piece of architectural herritage. 

Catherine Croft, Director of C20 Society: “We consider Dunelm House to be a remarkably intact survivor of its era...  ...We are extremely disappointed that the Minister has chosen to disregard the view of her heritage advisers (Historic England) and the Society in making this decision.”

attributes.action: Debate cost of Buckingham Palace refurbishment while NHS is in a critical state.
attributes.background: I work in the NHS. My role requires me to work at very many different trusts so I have a good overall picture of the state of affairs of the NHS. It is a very bad picture with a gloomy forecast. People are dying and more will die due to a lack of progressive strategic planning for the last 4 govts.

attributes.action: More of the foreign aid budget should be funded towards WASH Projects globally.
attributes.background: Priti Patel, the Secretary of State for International Development said British aid money had previously been wasted and stolen. Funds as such could have been used towards Water And Sanitation Hygiene Projects; which would work towards the Global Goal 6, ensuring the availability of water to everyone
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government provide 0.7% of the Gross National Income to International aid. Most of this money is spent on educating children, immunisation, refugees and encouraging global action on climate change. However the water crisis is a significantly problematic issue, as 1 in 9 people do not have access to clean water and adequate sanitation, which kills 5,000 children daily.This leads to a lack of education and rapid spread of diseases, forcing families to fall further into extreme poverty.

attributes.action: that caravans are only allowed on the public highway between 11pm and 6am.
attributes.background: Caravans are the bane of road users throughout the UK. If they can only travel at night then it will keep the country's roads clear during the day.
attributes.additional_details:
All you have to do is find a slow moving line of traffic in the summer and there will be 1 or 2 monster sized caravans being pulled by some woefully under powered car. To add to it, it will be rammed to the roof with holiday kit.
Get this menace out of the way during the day and keep the traffic moving.

attributes.action: Require universities to provide night-time safety to stop sexual harassment
attributes.background: Improve safety around the University at night for women and men when traveling and walking around the site.

attributes.action: Restore incentives for community owned renewable onshore wind
attributes.background:
A recent report reveals more than two thirds of the public support renewable energy schemes where projects are undertaken at a community level and local people receive financial benefit.
We , the signatories of this petition call upon parliament to revisit support for on shore wind subsidies.
attributes.additional_details:
News story on Community Energy report :
http://www.theecologist.org/News/news_round_up/2988096/massive_support_for_community_renewable_energy.html

attributes.action: All NHS ambulance trusts to use a life saving database which is free to use
attributes.background: The AUXILIUM SYSTEM was invented and funded after two local girls were killed on the way to and from school. The database was developed over several years from discussion with many Doctors Paramedics, Ambulance Hub Personnel etc. The database will be free for the NHS to use now and forever.
attributes.additional_details: If a person wearing an AUXILIUM number is found unconscious the number can be read to an ambulance call centre, then person’s information is relayed to paramedics regarding the patient before the paramedics arrive on the scene. .The AUXILIUM number costs only £1 per year per person, and you can change as many times as you wish .AUXILIUM has offered around 1,000,000 lifesaving numbers to charities and is now able to offer all schools in the UK a free number for all their pupils around 8 million.

attributes.action: Remove the words European Union from British passports.
attributes.background: As the country has voted to leave the European Union, we believe that the words European Union should be removed from British passports. Furthermore, we believe that the original black passports should be reinstated as soon as possible.

attributes.action: Make learning a foreign language compulsory from the 1st year of primary school
attributes.background: The UK has one of the lowest levels of multi-linguistic speakers. By keeping up with our European neighbours we will open up travel for the individual and business for the nation. The best way to learn a foreign language is to learn continuously from a young age, when the brain is most capable.
attributes.additional_details: Communication is key in international business and the UK government wishes to see more students taking up a foreign language at university. To facilitate a future nation of polyglots we need to prioritise foreign language as a core subject for children. Starting from the age of 5, or younger, when it's easiest to learn, and to be taught continuously through to adolescence so that every future adult has at least basic secondary language skills.

attributes.action: Implement a detection system to stop parental abduction of children leaving U.K
attributes.background: The government needs to implement a no nonsense approach to stopping one parent abducting a child to another country at Airports and all points of travel especially holiday seasons. Systems as such already exist in Canada, US and even in the Middle East.
attributes.additional_details:
Government needs to make sure kids cannot leave from the U.K without the consent of both parents 
"Nobody asked if he had my permission to take her" 
Sarah Taylor Rise in parental child abductions 
Foreign Office figures that show that the number of British children abducted by a parent and taken overseas has increased in the past year. 
A mother's lengthy search for her kidnapped child-http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk

attributes.action: Amend Consumer Protection Act 1987 to include advice given by consumer experts
attributes.background: Advice given by travel consumer experts in the media is always minimal. So much information is omitted that if anyone follows the advice they may suffer financial losses. The CPA 1987 should be amended to force these experts to explain what risks are involved in following their suggestions.
attributes.additional_details:
E.g. - Ravi Rajani on ITV's Lorraine (11/8/16) 
He did not warn of the financial risk when booking travel separately. This is irresponsible coming so soon after the collapse of a holiday company with inadequate financial cover. A consumer champion should advise that the protection offered by the Package Travel, Package Holidays and Package Tours Regulations 1992 and Atol is far more important than saving pennies on the booking.

attributes.action: Benefits paid onto a government photo ID which limits what can be purchased.
attributes.background:
Sign this so that tax payers benefits are not spent on holidays, cigarettes, drugs, alcohol or sky TV etc.  
Benefits should not pay for luxuries or for people to go out socialisng and buying items working people consider luxury and difficult to afford.
attributes.additional_details:
People on benefits need support to live but they should not be able to spend this tax payers support on items working class people struggle to afford.  Shops would be limited in the items they can sell and prosecuted if they sell alcohol, cigarettes, lottery tickets, holidays etc. 
Pre-loaded cards should be in  the form of photo ID and a database to have the ability to store the bar codes of items purchased as a way for debt advisors to support budgeting if required.

attributes.action: Increase government funding on organisations aiding terminal illness patients
attributes.background: Hospices and other organisations dedicate de to aiding those suffering from terminal illnesses such as dementia or cancer have been undervalued, either by a lack of pay or by an equal lack of resources, together we can increase welfare funding for such organisations such as these to beneficiaries.
attributes.additional_details: Organisations that enlist the aid of care professionals often being undervalued is often being seen in our headlines, our media is very biased in the covering of care workers and thus fewer people are as inclined to openly support the patients, their familles and carers through more comprehensive grief counselling and resources to truly allow these people a chance to live happily and find contentement despite any terminal illnesses.

attributes.action: Acknowledge the loss of our friend Harambe, and issue a statement of regret
attributes.background: Harambe was a proud, benevolent, and majestic creature. Closely related to we humans, we should mourn the passing of this loving being appropriately. His death will not be in vain. He died as he lived, protecting the innocent, and showing us all how to live our own lives. An inspiration.
attributes.additional_details: Harambe was gunned down in cold blood, on May 28th 2016. He was just seventeen years old. Harambe was agitated by the crowd baying for his blood, even as Primatologist Jane Goodall opined that he was trying to protect the poor child involved (http://www.janegoodall.org/wp-content/uploads/2796_001.pdf).

attributes.action: Revise the Honours system.
attributes.background: A cross-party body be set up to radically review the UK Honours system and replace it with one that works according to widely supported criteria and does not reward people for their political allegiances.
attributes.additional_details: Transparent and publicly supported criteria for awarding honours are required which reward people for services to community, the economy, country, mankind and the natural world, but not solely for political allegiance.

attributes.action: Cross party review of Hinkley Point C costs, design risks and EDF's commitment.
attributes.background:
Hinkley Point C go-ahead is imminent.
Review needed of:
- construction costs,
- design risks (design known to be a problem / unproven),
- EDF's commitment to UK project given their own nuclear fleet needs refurbishment,
- agreed strike-price and top up by customers now power prices have fallen
attributes.additional_details:
http://stophinkley.org/StopPress.htm
https://secure.greenpeace.org.uk/page/s/osborne-dont-waste-billions-nuclear?source=em&subsource=20160307egem01&utm_source=gpeace&utm_medium=em&utm_campaign=20160307egem01

attributes.action: Call for the DVLA to standardise gender identification on UK licences
attributes.background: Join us to campaign for gender equality. While licences for men start with their first name, all women have their first name prefixed with a marital status title such as 'Miss' / 'Mrs'. These options are selected at application stage, but whereby men selecting 'Mr' do not have this appear, women do.
attributes.additional_details: As a British National, only two forms of photo ID are recongnised; your passport and driver's licence. You driving licence is designed to be credit card sized, and in robust, thick plastic to be carried on your person at all times (unlike a paper passport). I love our country believe that in 2016 persons should be allowed to have their main, day-to-day ID display a fair indicator of the gender they identify with, rather than singling out women with a relationship status.

attributes.action: Bring back levels for assessment and stop labelling our children as failures.
attributes.background: Children who don't meet the expected standard for their year group are being assessed as emerging and not 'Year _ ready'. Essentially we are telling them they have failed! Children need encouragement not labelling in this way. Levels mean that progress can easily be seen year on year.
attributes.additional_details: A whole generation of our children risk being labelled failures by the system that replaced levels. Previously a child and their parents would easily see progress during a school year by looking at their levels. Currently they are labelled as 'emerging', 'expected' or 'exceeding' and a child who is emerging is then described as not being ready for the next year group that they move in to. If our children are to achieve their true potential, we need to stop labelling them as failures!

attributes.action: Ensure there are dedicated disability wards for over 18s in hospitals
attributes.background: Our beautiful disabled daughter/Sister age 26 died of Pneumonia and we think the care of the ward could of been a lot better if there was a dedicated ward with 1 to 1 care and trained disability nurses!

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all schools to have carbohydrate content lists
attributes.background:
Diabetic children all over the Uk miss hot school meals as there's no legal requirement for school to have carb  contents for their meals. 
As a diabetic child, Riley (7) has to injection insulin every time he eats, the amount depends on the carbs he is about to eat. Without this info he cannot eat
attributes.additional_details:
As a type1 diabetic you must inject inject insulin with all food and drink for life, there is no cure, there is also no cause so it's unpreventable!
The amount you inject depends on the amount of carbohydrate you are about to eat.
At the minute there is no legal requirement for schools to have this information meaning children are missing out on a hot school meal.
I believe all schools in the uk should have a list of carbohydrate contents for each meal so our children can eat a healthy hot meal

attributes.action: Pressure NICE to approve Nivolumab for lung cancer patients
attributes.background: Denied by Nice in England and Wales, this drug is freely available in Scotland. This drug could help cure patients suffering from Lung cancer, yet the government won't allow its use. Sign today lets start changing this disgrace immediately

attributes.action: Greyhounds to be muzzled at all times when out in public places
attributes.background: A neighbours cat was mauled to death by two greyhounds. Although the dogs were on leads the owner was unable to control them. It is law in Northern Ireland for greyhounds to be muzzled this needs to be extended to the rest of the UK

attributes.action: Make individuals' contributions to the DFID International Aid budget voluntary
attributes.background: The international aid budget is out of control and management of it is not fit for purpose since much of it is wasted through ill advised means of spending or just plain poor management by, amongst others, unelected staff with their own agenda. Many UK citizens believe 'charity begins at home'.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing citizens to either 'opt in' or 'opt out' through their annual tax return, HMRC will still be able to collect the tax from those who wish to pay it while allowing others to pay their contribution to their preferred, domestic, budgets. Overall, the actual percentage size of the budget will reflect the proportion of citizens willing to pay for overseas aid.

attributes.action: Take action to make victims feel more able to report sexual violence.
attributes.background: According to "An overview of Sexual Offending"(Jan 2013) 57% of women who have been raped told someone but not the police, 28% told no one. More must be done to ensure that victims feel able to report incidents and be taken seriously. I suggest closer collaboration with charities such as rape crisis
attributes.additional_details:
See "An Overview of Sexual Offendinf in England and Wales" (Ministry of Justice, Home Office &a Office for National Statistics) for more general statistics. 
I submit this petition in the hope that it will prompt wider debate about the way in which sexual violence is treated within the criminal justice system and how victims are treated.

attributes.action: Businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on.
attributes.background:
Its time to create a law that all businesses must close their doors, if they have to put their heating on. 
If everyone does it we can beat the myth that open doors in winter are welcoming, and we can do our part to cut our heating bills and contribute to saving the environment at the same time.

attributes.action:
Give Foster Carers employee rights. 
Why do they have to be self employed
attributes.background:
why is it Foster Carers Are forced to be self employed in  a highly regulated profession. Local Authorities and Independent fostering agencies can get away without offering their foster Carers employment rights. 
 Foster Carers can only work for one IFA or LA they are not independent contractors

attributes.action: Have a progressive capital gains tax in the U.K for high net worth individuals.
attributes.background: Only wealthy people make large gains on their assets; yet they pay the same as working people earning £11,000 to £43,000 per year; this is obviously unfair and perpetuates inequality. Let's create a fairer society where our taxes don't benefit the wealthy and everyone really pays their fair share.
attributes.additional_details:
The FTSE 100 average yearly gain is 5.4% (Motley Fool UK).  Yet average yearly earning income increases between 2001 and 2016 is just 2.3% (ONS). Clearly a CGT rate of 20% benefits the wealthy.
CGT shouldn't change for companies, only for high net worth individuals. Capital investment is essential to our economy; and individuals won't be put off investing if they have to pay 40% on their profits like everyone else. Changing CGT would improve inequality and provide revenue for the government.

attributes.action: Not new grammar schools, put the funding into high achieving comprehensives.
attributes.background: In September, PM Theresa May announced the government's plans to reintroduce selective state education in the form of grammar schools. Students are selected by 11+ exams, not the age to be determining the schooling for the next 7 years. The government should prioritise existing comprehensives.
attributes.additional_details: The Government want these schools to be allowed to be created once again. This was not what was voted for in the 2015 Conservative manifesto, David Cameron was highly against grammar schools. The money should go to the success that is comprehensive schools. Studies have shown that comprehensive students have fared better at university and they achieve, even with non selection, competitive grades, why should the government try to separate students rather than fund comprehensive schooling more?

attributes.action: Make Bioptic Lenses acceptable for achieving the eyesight standard for driving.
attributes.background: Bioptic Lenses are small optical scopes, that are mounted onto the spectacle frame, to help people with sight loss see extra detail in distant objects or texts. Often used to assist visually impaired individuals that still have a functional level of vision to complete everyday tasks such as driving.
attributes.additional_details: Bioptic driving began over 30 years ago in the US and is currently accepted in over 37 states as well as several European Countries, for both car and motorcycle licenses.  Current UK standards for driving have taken away the freedom and independence of thousands of individuals that would otherwise pose no additional risk to road users.  Consideration, in particular, should be given to those with stable non-progressive visual disorders, where Bioptics would allow them to meet the vision standard.
